en_title: Investment Law and Investor-State Mediator Training Course co-organised by DoJ concluded successfully (with photos)
zh_title: 律政司合辦投資法及國際投資爭端調解技巧培訓課程圓滿結束（附圖）

en: World-renowned trainers in the international investment law and investor-state mediation were invited to share their knowledge and expertise at a one-week training course co-organised by the Department of Justice (DoJ), the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID) and the Asian Academy of International Law. The training course concluded successfully today (November 3).

Following the success of the inaugural round last year, the Investment Law and Investor-State Mediator Training Course was held again this year commencing on October 28. At the opening ceremony, the Secretary for Justice, Ms Teresa Cheng, SC, said that the DoJ is devoted to developing Hong Kong into an international investment law and investment dispute resolution skills training base with a view to building up a team of investment mediators specialised in handling international investment disputes in Asia.

Topics covered in this year's training include the fundamentals of international investment law, and topical issues raised in international investment disputes and dispute resolution process. The training course also engages participants through role play in investment mediation, and explores topics such as mediation process consideration and stakeholder mapping analysis for case studies.

The training course attracted enthusiastic responses. About 40 participants from around the world, including government officials as well as legal and mediation practitioners from the Mainland, Association of Southeast Asian Nations countries, the Middle East, Africa and Hong Kong, gathered in Hong Kong for intellectual and professional exchange in these subject areas.

The training course included a stellar line-up of participating trainers, comprising experts from the ICSID, International Energy Charter and the Centre for Effective Dispute Resolution as well as experienced practitioners and academics in the field.

With the conclusion of the investment agreement under the framework of the Mainland and Hong Kong Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement on June 28, 2017, which provides mediation as a means of dispute resolution, the training course is one of the DoJ's related initiatives.
zh: 律政司與國際投資爭端解決中心及亞洲國際法律研究院合辦為期一周的培訓課程，邀請了世界知名的投資法及國際投資爭端調解培訓員分享經驗和專業知識，課程今日（十一月三日）圓滿結束。
去年首次舉辦的投資法及國際投資爭端調解技巧培訓課程非常成功，課程由今年十月二十八日再度展開。律政司司長鄭若驊資深大律師出席開幕禮時表示，律政司致力發展香港成為國際投資法及國際投資爭端調解技巧培訓的基地，為亞洲區建立處理國際投資爭議的投資調解員團隊。
今年的培訓課程內容包括國際投資法基礎，以及與國際投資爭端及爭議解決方式相關的重要議題等，並透過調解員角色扮演，鼓勵參與者探索調解程序時需要考慮的不同層面、持份者分析等不同題目。
是次課程反應踴躍，來自世界各地約四十位參與者，包括中國内地、東南亞國家聯盟成員國、中東、非洲和香港的政府官員以及法律和調解從業員等，在香港聚首進行專業交流。
培訓課程講者陣容鼎盛，包括來自國際投資爭端解決中心、國際能源憲章和有效爭論決議中心的專家，以及富經驗的業界人士及學者。
在《內地與香港關於建立更緊密經貿關係的安排》下於二○一七年六月二十八日簽訂的投資協議，訂定調解為解決爭議的途徑。上述培訓課程是律政司的其中一項主導項目。
